sen.j: 宮大工（みやだいく）は、神社寺院の建築や補修に携わる大工。
sen.e: The term "miyadaiku" refers to a carpenter "daiku" involved in the construction and repair of Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples.

sen.j: 渡り大工とも呼ばれ、何年も家を離れ社寺のある地に居住して材料、技法を検討しながら仕事を進める。
sen.e: Also referred to as "wataridaiku", these craftsmen spend many years away from home living on the sites of temples or shrines where they develop their skills as they study materials and techniques.
